TopicTitle: STS-7/E Space Shuttle (Stock NASA Replica) Still Flies in KSP 1.4.3 - Re-enters Like the Real Thing!

Articles.Content:

Hey xoknight, any chance you can fix your subassembly to not use a blue separator? It winds up as debris on eject. May I suggest a Sr. Docking port and can you reupload that?

I'd like to request one other in memoriam in the OP, for the Challenger, mission STS-51-L. The necessary information, including the mission badge, is HERE.

I understand that the Columbia is more in the minds of younger folks, but it was the destruction of the Challenger that almost ended American Space exploration forever, such was the nation's grief. Thanks!

Edited March 15, 2015 by Ticondrius
Challenger will be remembered in a separate video, with any 1.0 shuttle dedicated in such memory.

I'd like to request one other in memoriam in the OP, for the Challenger, mission STS-51-L. The necessary information, including the mission badge, is HERE.

I understand that the Columbia is more in the minds of younger folks, but it was the destruction of the Challenger that almost ended American Space exploration forever, such was the nation's grief. Thanks!

Well, despite both of them being Space Shuttles, I think they both have totally different stories and morales.

I think STS-51L was about prioritizing human life regardless of delays here and there, and should always be put first above all things.Morton Thiokol (SRBS Manufacturer) knew about the SRB flaws in such cold weather, but decided to go on, even if it means risking seven lives.

STS-107 was more of being prepared for any possibility, even it it's just a bunch of foam tumbling on a wing. No one knew that it would cause yet another seven brave men and women dead.

Regardless, it's still tragic, even though the death toll isn't as significant as some other crashes. Just my opinion. But yes, I think both disasters deserve a memorial.

I'm not fond of Realism, but I guarantee that if you fly it with RO, and draft a flight profile, I'll spoilerize it in the OP.
Just thought I would let you know that Kerbal Inventory System has been released. It was mentioned that KAS will lose its containers and its ability to grab parts when it is updated next.

Thank you! Have you flown her? Have any pics?

Nope I did not, I aleady have mine but I can easily see that there is work inside and that this is well designed !

Just thought I would let you know that Kerbal Inventory System has been released. It was mentioned that KAS will lose its containers and its ability to grab parts when it is updated next.

Thanks for the heads up. I am not sure I follow though. Is KAS saying they are no longer going to be having containers in future KAS versions? And if people want containers they will have to install the separate KIS mod? Can KIS do the same thing as KAS when its stand alone?

Edited March 17, 2015 by inigma

Thanks for the heads up. I am not sure I follow though. Is KAS saying they are no longer going to be having containers in future KAS versions? And if people want containers they will have to install the separate KIS mod? Can KIS do the same thing as KAS when its stand alone?

Yeah KAS is removing the containers and the ability to grab parts. That functionality is going to only be available in KIS. The winches, pipes and such will still be part of KAS.

Here is the link to KIS:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113111-0-90-Kerbal-Inventory-System-%28KIS%29-1-0-0

Edit: I have played around a little bit with KIS and it is a lot easier to put parts in the container in VAB. It has made any part removable as long as you have enough kerbals (1 ton per kerbal). Also, kerbals have their own inventory that can store small items like lights and such.

Edited March 17, 2015 by ExplorerKlatt

just thought i would let you know that kerbal inventory system has been released. It was mentioned that kas will lose its containers and its ability to grab parts when it is updated next.
